H0.text: A compound is the snack Ben is eating, which contains raisins, chocolate pieces, and nuts, from which he picks out all the raisins.

H1.text: An element is the best description of the snack Ben is eating, which contains raisins, chocolate pieces, and nuts, but Ben removes all of the raisins as he eats.

H2.text: A solution is the snack Ben is eating, composed of raisins, chocolate pieces, and nuts, from which he picks out all of the raisins.

H3.text: A mixture is the snack Ben is eating, consisting of raisins, chocolate pieces, and nuts that he picks out as he eats.

A4.text: Mixtures can be separated by physical methods such as filtration, freezing, and distillation.

A5.text: In solutions, solutes will not settle out after any period of time and they cannot be removed by physical methods, such as a filter or centrifuge.
